rComments: Very involved lectures. Really cared about his students. I was so sad to hear that he wasn't going to teach the class after I took it. If he's still teaching at UCSC: get in his class. You won't regret it. He is very helpful, clear to follow, and if you follow the steps he gives you, I'm sure you'll pass. There was a textbook, but we never used it.

He was a pretty good teacher. Most of the concepts he taught were really clear, and he was very generous with curves on his tests. His class made me not hate math too much. It sucked that he left though

Ryan is by far my favorite math teacher I have ever had. He made my first college math experience a great one by being so helpful& you can see his passion shine through his teachings and lectures. He can easily relate to his students, you can tell he genuinely cares about his students& wants each and everyone to pass. SO SAD HE IS LEAVING THOUGH!

Such an amazing professor. His teaching style is so clear and easy to understand. He is a very fair grader and gives you the grade you deserve. Easy to talk to and entertaining. Sad that he won't be teaching here anymore but I'm glad I had the chance to take the class with him.

OMG I had Carroll for Math 3 at 8pm. I thought the class would be boring at 8pm but no this guy has a lot of energy. He is very clear on the topics and he encourages you to ask question. My favorite professor so far. He wants you to succeed in his math classes! Overall he's a chill and inspirational guy! I would take him for any math class!

He's super cool and good at what he teaches. He'll work hard to make sure you understand his class, and he really does care about his student's grades. Ryan likes to make jokes, and he is himself in front of the class, not to mention he's 24 and super cute! He's a thrill to be around, and I would highly recommend getting into one of his classes.
